text:
The end is near and the Marvel Cinematic Universe will not be the same, thereafter. Avengers: Endgame will soon wrap up an enormous 22 film saga. Half of the universe’s population is already dead including many superheros; who will die next leaving fans shattered remains to be seen.
fsmedia.imgix.net
The co-director of the movie Joe Russo is in India for the promotions of the movie, which is scheduled to be released on April 26. He released A R Rahman’s Marvel anthem for fans yesterday. The track, a perfect tribute to the fans especially ahead of the release of Endgame, is composed, produced and sung by the music maestro.
AFP
Apart from this, Joe Russo revealed some interesting connection that he has with Indian cinema. He said that the ending of the Marvel 2015 movie Avengers: Age of Ultron almost had a scene inspired by Rajinikanth starrer Robot.
Don't Miss 264 SHARES 282 SHARES 233 SHARES 159 SHARES
“'Robot' almost influenced the climatic moments in 'Avengers: Age of Ultron'... In one of the final scenes all the Ultrons were suppose to form a large Ultron and Avengers were set to fight that but the sequence got cut for time. It was this close. I was inspired directly by 'Robot',” he was quoted as saying by PTI.
What’s more? The ace filmmaker has watched Salman Khan’s Dabangg and he feels the camera work in the movie was amazing. I'm an action director so I saw 'Dabangg' many years ago. I still have to see 'Dabangg 2'. I thought the camera work was great in those movies. The tone and the energy is also great. So, I certainly know Salman Khan," he added.
Apart from this, he even said that he finds Priyanka Chopra fantastic and would love to work with her. “Priyanka is transitioning into global status now. She is fantastic... (I would) Love to work with her... I am potentially talking to Priyanka for something. I am not going to say what it is.”
Twitter
Marvel is anyway working on a standalone movie on Ms Marvel AKA Kamala Khan. When the news was announced, fans expressed their wish to see Priyanka Chopra as Marvel's first Muslim superhero. Will Russo brothers cast him in that role? Only time will tell. Meanwhile, Avengers: Endgame is slated to release on April 26.
title: Avengers Director Joe Russo Inspired By Rajinikanth's Robot, Also Loved Watching Salman Khan’s Dabangg
